description: Shanghai Mini is a release in the series of Activision's tile matching games. Included are Classic, Tournament and Dynasty modes. Classic is the normal game with six different board layouts. In Tournament, the player challenges the Tower of Shanghai and tries to beat the Shanghai Master by solving different board layouts within a time limit. Dynasty is a two player competition - against the computer or a human opponent (requires a link cable).

sample_screenshots.caption: Tournament mode has a time limit.

title: Shanghai Mini

description: Take control of Sonic on the road with Sonic Pocket Adventure. Travel through 9 zones bashing robots and collecting rings. In addition to traditional Sonic gameplay this cartridge features Time Trial, Link Battle, and Puzzle modes. In puzzle mode the player can arrange "puzzle pieces" collected through the levels and unlock hidden pictures. To facilitate the on-again, off-again gameplay common in handhelds, you may restart your game on any unlocked zone or act. Similarly this game features multiple levels of difficulty and the option to turn off the standard 10 minute time limit on each level.

sample_screenshots.caption: Sonic finds your first enemy and starts a jump attack.
An "unknown" dark hedgehog shows the stage name.

title: Sonic The Hedgehog Pocket Adventure

description: As a member of the elite forces squad "Peregrine Falcons," your mission is to eliminate the evil Colonel Bildegaarn. Using the Metal Slug multifunction tank and the Slug Flyer as well as your wits and handgun blast through up to 17 missions in your quest to make the world safe from tyranny. Multiple stage progressions and a gameplay ranking system give reason to play through more than once. In-game save lets the player on the go turn off the Neo Geo Pocket and not lose progress.
title: Metal Slug 1st Mission

description: Compete in the SC Card Fighters' Clash tournament with your SNK deck in this NGPC card game. Collect the 300 cards from both SNK and Capcom franchises and duel and trade with your friends using the extensive link mode. With mechanics similar to CCGs such as Yu-Gi-Oh and popular characters from both SNK and Capcom, Card Fighters clash offers both collection and strategy gameplay. This game also allows linking with SNK vs. Capcom: Match of the Millennium to transfer collectible points.
title: SNK vs. Capcom: Card Fighters' Clash - SNK Cardfighter's Version

description: Compete in the SC Card Fighters' Clash tournament with your Capcom deck in this NGPC card game. Collect the 300 cards from both SNK and Capcom franchises and duel and trade with your friends using the extensive link mode. With mechanics similar to CCGs such as Yu-Gi-Oh and popular characters from both SNK and Capcom, Card Fighters clash offers both collection and strategy gameplay. This game also allows linking with SNK vs. Capcom: Match of the Millennium to transfer collectible points.

sample_screenshots.caption: Choosing cards  - here is Jill from Resident Evil
After the first fight, I can move around
Options of the card battle screen

title: SNK vs. Capcom: Card Fighters' Clash - Capcom Cardfighter's Version

description: Take control of the Metal Slug tank on the NGPC once again, this time to defeat the rebel strike force "Phantom." Travel through 38 stages in a non-linear battle path defeating enemy troops and rescuing hostages. Pilot the Metal Slug tank, Slug Flyer combat jet, and the Slug Sub submarine and fire the heavy machine gun, rocket launcher, and fire gun. Two unique playable characters, a list of rescued hostages, and a time attack mode add depth to this side-scroller.
title: Metal Slug 2nd Mission

description:
A side story to the original Ogre Battle, Zenobia no Ōji's plot takes place during the fourteenth chapter ("The Capital of Milano") of the original game.

Much like its predecessor, the game is a blend of traditional RPG and strategy gameplay. As the hero of the game, you lead a growing army of troops as you progress through the game in a series of pivotal battles. Before each battle you are given the option to setup your army into distinct groups. Then you are given a mission on the map and you can then set your army out to do your bidding. As your unit groups travel along the map on the way to their given objective, they'll happen along enemy unit groups. When they meet, the game switches to an isometric view of the automated turn-based battle that ensues.
title: Densetsu no Ogre Battle: Zenobia no Ōji

description:
A portable version of Evolution: The World of Sacred Device. Eternal Dungeon tells the story of the young explorer Mag Launcher and his quest for the fabled Evolutia, an item of immense power.

The basic premise of the game is to take quests in the town and then assemble your party and attempt to clear out the many dungeons in the game, grinding your characters and getting the loot and experience needed to advance the plot and buy items, equipment, and upgrades for your Cy-frame, a robotic attachment that enables Mag to enhance his combat abilities.

As expected for a portable version, the gameplay has been significantly downgraded from its original Dreamcast version. Town navigation is menu-driven and all graphics are now top-down 2D sprites, with all dungeons being pre-designed instead of randomly generated. Combat is turn-based using a menu system from which you select your actions for each party member (up to 3) and execute them, but otherwise remains unchanged.

sample_screenshots.caption: You can talk to your party members, but, unfortunately, instead of character interaction, you'll only get tips on how to play.
The English translation hasn't been proofread well.
The maps really are nothing to write home about.

title: Evolution: Eternal Dungeons

description:
In this game you keep watch on the wacky Neo Poke-kun, a cartoony programmer thing that lives locked in his small Tokyo apartment. You don't have direct control of his actions but instead interact with him indirectly by switching stuff in his apartment on and off, which triggers different reactions from him. More importantly you can invite different characters to visit Neo Poke-kun, which will also trigger different reactions from him. Depending on the time of day and the visitor you may get different reactions from Poke-kun, and if you make him happy enough he'll get to work and code a mini-game for you.

These collection of 30 games form the bulk of the gameplay, and include different clones of other games, shooters, short platformers, and compact puzzle challenges similar to Wario Ware.

The game has a distinctly bizarre sense of humor with wacky animations played whenever something happens to your Poke-kun, and while some games use basic vector graphics, most use 2D sprites.

sample_screenshots.caption: A Sumo game where you choose the direction and power of your shove to kick the enemy out of the ring.
But the only attack Neo Poke-kun has is Terry Bogard's Burn Knuckle.
Kill ghosts that pop up with spears.
This game predates WarioWare but the way it works is that when Poke-kun is in the mood, he will create games for you to play. Annoy him or hurt him and you'll be waiting for new games for days...

title: Ganbare Neo Poke-kun

description:
Crush Roller is a game for the Neo Geo Pocket Color based on the 1981 arcade game Make Trax, which was released as Crush Roller in Europe and Asia.

The object of the game is to color the entire maze-like playing field with a paint brush. While you paint, two enemies walk around in the maze, when they hit you, you lose a life.

A level has rollers which you can push forward with your paint brush. If you capture an enemy in the path of the roller he dies and is temporarily taken out of the game. This scores you extra points. Each subsequent enemy rolled over is worth more points.

Every once in a while another creature will pop up, it will run around leaving behind track marks in your paint. Painting over this creature removes it from the game and scores you additional points. His tracks have to be repainted.

When the entire maze is painted you win the level. Unlike the original arcade version the Neo Geo Pocket Color version has multiple levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: You can use the rollers to crush the enemies tracking you.
When you finish a level, you can select which level you want to play next.
Painting the whole level to the color of your brush clears it.
A nice introduction to the game and its characters.

title: Crush Roller

description:
Kikou Seiki Unitron is the sequel to Biomotor Unitron. It was only released in Japan.

It continues the gameplay of Biomotor Unitron with top down dungeons and menu-based combat. The story takes place 400 years in the future from the original. This time you control 10 characters. Like the original your main priorities are upgrading your Unitron robot. The game features more dungeons than the original and they are partly randomized on each play through. Using a link cable you can pit your Unitron against that of friends.

sample_screenshots.caption: There's a wide choice of assistants. A human girl.

title: Kikou Seiki Unitron

description:
Dark Arms: Beast Buster 1999 is a RPG for the Neo Geo Pocket Color. It's a spin-off from the arcade game Beast Busters.

Parallel to our world we find the Dark Realm. As the player, you find access to this parallel dimension after signing a pact with the Master of the Dark Realm. In his realm, you are supposed to catch monsters. These can be fed to your biological weapons: Dark Arms. You weapons gain abilities from consumed monsters and can evolve into more powerful equipment. You can also find seeds in the Dark Realm that turn into new weapons.

The game features puzzles that have to be solved and a wide array of undead monsters that can be fed to your Dark Arms.

sample_screenshots.caption: Once fully upgraded, this weapon shoots multiple shots and covers you in armor
An organic weapon destroys a zombie
Female zombies throw knives, better get that health power-up
Map screen at night with 2 new areas unlocked

title: Dark Arms: Beast Buster 1999

description:
Faselei! is one of the last titles to be released for the Neo Geo Pocket Color and even features digitised lyrics to the game's main theme. Heavily story driven, this strategy RPG takes place in a time when mechs known as TS are the weapon of choice for combat. Gameplay revolves around the battles and customising your TS between those battles.

Battles are part turn based and part realtime. The player inputs their actions at the beginning of the turn. The amount of actions they can input is dependant on their type of TS. Once they have finished their selection everything is played out in realtime for the duration of the turn. This makes thinking about what your opponents and allies will do in advance essential before taking your turn.
title: Faselei!

description:
Dive Alert: Becky's Version is an RPG for the Neo Geo Pocket Color. There is another version of Dive Alert called Dive Alert: Matt's Version. The two games are rather like joint Pokemon releases (Red/Blue, etc) wherein they are overall the same game with a variety of smaller differences.

The player takes control of a character named Becky. The game takes place in the future and the world is primarily surrounded by water. The only land is a small patch called Terra. The player must prove their worth to be accepted on to Terra by proving their skill as a submarine commander and destroying enemy vessels.

Becky's version features different characters, items and boats from Matt's Version. These are logged in a device similar to a Pokédex (from Pokemon). Battles take place against enemy ships and a radar view is used to help the player guide torpedoes towards the enemy vessels. Much of the game is text-based with animated cutscenes.

The game features the ability for two players to link up Neo Geo Pocket Color units to exchanges ships and data, and to battle one on one. The game also features battery back-up and a training mode.

sample_screenshots.caption: The training is a departure from the top-down combat in the game.
Now we need to choose our submarine. Here's a turtle.

title: Dive Alert: Becky's Version

description:
The gameplay of Puzzle Link 2 is generally identical to the first game: Puzzle Link is a game where blocks of matching color have to be dissolved. New blocks constantly scroll into the screen from the top. The game is over when the first blocks reach the bottom of the screen. You can dissolve blocks by shooting at them. The shots form a line where they impact. If that line connects otherwise unconnected blocks of the same color they will dissolve.

There are new modes in Puzzle Link 2. Like the original, there are the standard challenge and puzzle rounds. But new to the series is the marathon-style game where you continue eliminating pieces as the game gradually increases speed. In this mode, more power-ups appear as the player performs faster. Here, you get three shots that will eliminate the same color tile from the board. The game also has link cable support for two players.

sample_screenshots.caption: There are some new modes in the second game.
The aim of the game is simple: connect objects of the same shape and color.
The cutscenes before the game starts are quite cute.

title: Puzzle Link 2

description:
Memories Off: Pure is a prequel to Memories Off. The events of the game take place three years before those of the previous game, when the protagonist Tomoya Mikami was still attending middle school. The game primarily revolves around his relationships with his childhood friend Yue Imasaka and Ayaka Hizuki, whose tragic fate is mentioned in the first game.

Gameplay-wise, the prequel is identical to the preceding game, with the gameplay being reduced to occasional decision-making that influences the course of the story and ultimately leads it to different endings.
title: Memories Off: Pure

description: Super Real Mahjong Premium Collection is the first handheld installment in the Super Real Mahjong series. As usual, you play strip mahjong with pretty girls, this time several from many of the games. However, due to the system's limitations, only a few strip scenes are animated. It also has some visual novel-like qualities, particularly a story mode where you try to focus on one girl each time it is played. This is accomplished by choosing the right options when they are presented to you. If you succeed in focusing on only one girl, her CG is then unlocked in the gallery.

sample_screenshots.caption: Talking to Akira (my favorite SRM girl).

title: Super Real Mahjong Premium Collection

description:
Bust-A-Move Pocket is an installment in the long-running puzzle series exclusive to the Neo Geo Pocket Color. It offers a selection of modes and levels seen in earlier entries.

The game includes three different game modes. Puzzle mode consists of 99 puzzles, taken from various earlier entries in the series for a "best of". The first ten levels can be selected from the start, and the best clearing times are saved per level. VS mode is the competitive variant of the game, played in best-of-three matches either against one of several different CPU opponents (with different strategies) or against another player via link connection. Survivor mode is an endless mode played for high score.

Gameplay follows the standard model: the player controls a cannon at the bottom of the play field that shoots randomly colored bubbles. When three or more bubbles of the same color touch, they are removed from the field. In puzzle mode, the ceiling moves downward after a while, while in the other modes, additional bubbles are added from the top. In survivor mode only, bubbles also are added from the bottom sometimes. The game is lost once the bubbles reach the bottom. Popping more than three bubbles at a time moves extra bubbles to the opponent's field in VS mode.

sample_screenshots.caption: Aiming in a blue flashing ball.
Shooting a yellow bubble needed to clear a group of the same color.

title: Bust-A-Move Pocket

description:
This limited edition package includes the following items:

  • Densetsu no Ogre Battle: Zenobia no Ōji
  • A Crystal Blue Neo-Geo Pocket Color system
title: Densetsu no Ogre Battle: Zenobia no Ōji (Gentei Box)

description:
The goal of Delta Warp is to gather all the 'Delta Power units' in each stage as quickly as possible. To do this, you must navigate your 'Delta' around the stage, changing its colour between white and black to match the colour of the Delta Power unit. Moving across the stage with the joystick will cause the Delta's colour to alternate with each space. However, pressing A or B will rotate the player-unit around the diamond patterns that make up the stage without the colour changing. The complexity of the levels gradually increases with the introduction of new mechanics such as multi-floor stages and special tiles that change the properties of the Delta.

In addition to the game's one hundred original stages, it also features a level editor which allows you to create your own stages and trade them with others. A two-player 'Battle' mode is also available through the link cable.
title: Delta Warp

description:
Cool Boarders Pocket is a snowboarding game from the Cool Boarders series.

Compared to the home console version, this game changes the perspective to an isometric view and switches the focus of the game from pulling off stunts to navigating from start to finish. Players can choose one of two playable characters (Ken or Jun) and then can choose the Free Ride or Survival modes.

The Free Ride mode requires players to complete a level as fast as possible, while the Survival mode has players go through an endless stage until they lose all their health. Beating the best time on the Free Ride stages will unlock new courses, including special bonus stages. Players will constantly have to avoid obstacles and jump over gaps in order to progress through the levels.

The game also offers an unlockable Snowgirl Mode, which allows players to control a snowboarding snowman.

sample_screenshots.caption: You can choose between a boy or a girl.
Gameplay: avoid bumping into the walls.
There are 2 modes in the game.

title: Cool Boarders Pocket

description: Picture Puzzle is a puzzle game in the same vein as Mario's Picross. The goal is to reveal the hidden picture, using the numbers along the sides of the grid to determine how many squares each line and column is to have. Picture Puzzle has over 200 puzzles, separated into 5x5, 10x10, and 15x15 grids.

sample_screenshots.caption: A '0' means nothing in that column.

title: Picture Puzzle

description: Pocket Reversi is an adaptation by Success of the classic strategy game. In single-player, you must make your way through Tournament Mode, competing against eight progressively difficult opponents. You can also take the 'Ability Level Test' which grades you based on your play. For beginners, 'Reversi Lesson' provides ten short tutorial sessions to teach you the basics of the game. There's also a 'Free Play' mode where you can choose to see all available moves and to even take back your last move. Finally, there's a two-player mode accessible via the link cable.

sample_screenshots.caption: The last 3 matches have only eight mins. instead of ten.
CPU is happy while ahead on points.

title: Pocket Reversi

description:
Soreyuke!! Hanafuda Dōjō is a Hanafuda game of traditional Japanese flower cards. It features the Koi-Koi game type, comprehensive rule configuration and three different play modes:* Battle (link cable two-player versus)

  • Certification (rank your skills)
  • Tournament (versus eight different computer players)
title: Soreyuke!!: Hanafuda Dōjō

description:
SNK vs Capcom: Cardfighters' Clash 2 - Expanded Edition is the sequel to SNK vs. Capcom: Card Fighters' Clash - SNK Cardfighter's Version and SNK vs. Capcom: Card Fighters' Clash - Capcom Cardfighter's Version.

It contains 124 more cards from new franchises such as Garou: Mark of the Wolves and Dino Crisis than the original versions, with 40 of them being a new Reaction type card that you can use in the counterattack portion of a round. Players can choose to start the game either with an SNK or Capcom oriented deck. All the originals collectable card game elements and Yu-Gi-Oh!-esque gameplay remains intact, with the ability to play single matches versus the AI or a human opponent using the link mode. Presentation of the game's story has also moved from a top down RPG to being a visual novel style.
title: SNK vs Capcom: Card Fighters' Clash 2 - Expand Edition

description:
Neo Dragon's Wild is a video poker game.

B button is used to bet in the initial stage, being able to bet between 1 and 5 credits. A is then used to draw. Once the initial cards are drawn, the player can choose to hold using B, or draw with A. There is an auto hold feature that can be turned off from the default on. The second draw will either end with the player losing, or winning. If the player wins, they then have the option to double using the B button, or take your winnings with A. If you choose to double your winnings, you will enter a mini game of high or low card, which will continue until you either take your winning or lose.

There are screens giving odds for different card combinations, book keeping tracking what outcomes you have had at all aspects of the game, as well as multiple saves.

sample_screenshots.caption: Winning a hand (option to double or take)

title: Neo Dragon's Wild

description:
Neo Mystery Bonus is a casino slots machine, with a few extra bonus games activated by certain outcomes.

Using A and B, the player is able to set bets, spin the reel, and choose whether to take any winnings, or double up or "DUP", as the game shortens it too. The doubling up mini game is High Low cards, with the game providing you the previous 5 cards. This can be played to double any success in the slots machine, which depending on your bets, will reward you for combinations starting with the central row for 1 credit, then the top most row, the bottom row, a top left to bottom right diagonal and bottom left to top right diagonal at 5 credits, added in that order. You can add more credits, following the same order, up to a maximum of 10. There are a variety of combinations that will pay out different odds depending on the combination. Some of these combinations will activate their own mini games, such as the title's Mystery Bonus for getting three question marks lined up.

There are book keeping menus, as well as instructions on how to play and on the payouts for each combination.
title: Neo Mystery Bonus

description: Pachi-Slot Aruze Ōkoku Pocket: Azteca is a pachi slot simulation game with an Aztec and western theme. Credit is added with the A button, reels are begun by flicking the joystick, and stopped by pressing any face button. The game imitates the appearance of a physical machine, with sprites mimicking 8 segment displays and buttons.
title: Pachi-Slot Aruze Ōkoku Pocket: Azteca

description:
Dive Alert: Matt's Version is an RPG for the Neo Geo Pocket Color. There is another version of Dive Alert called Dive Alert: Becky's Version. The two games are rather like joint Pokemon releases (Red/Blue, etc) wherein they are overall the same game with a variety of smaller differences.

The player takes control of a character named Matt. The game takes place in the future and the world is primarily surrounded by water. The only land is a small patch called Terra. The player must prove their worth to be accepted on to Terra by proving their skill as a submarine commander and destroying enemy vessels.

Matt's version features different characters, items and boats from Becky's Version. These are logged in a device similar to a Pokédex (from Pokemon). Battles take place against enemy ships and a radar view is used to help the player guide torpedoes towards the enemy vessels. Much of the game is text-based with animated cutscenes.

The game features the ability for two players to link up Neo Geo Pocket Color units to exchanges ships and data, and to battle one on one. The game also features battery back-up and a training mode.
title: Dive Alert: Matt's Version

description:
Cool Cool Jam is a rhythm-based game released simultaneously with Cool Cool Toon for the Dreamcast. Players take control of Wave or Midi - Kids that got transported 1000 years into the future to a world full of colorful music loving characters in a town called Musey Town. Upon arriving to the town, you find out from Lan-K, a bass guitar player, that there's only one way to return to your world and that's to become a musical sensation and impress the Jazzy Egg. Thus, having only a bass player from the beginning, players have one week to form a band and achieve this goal.

Musey town is broken up into several areas each having their own theme and music genre and players will need to talk to various inhabitants and complete a mini-game involving clapping at the right time based on a tune's rhythm. Successfully completing this mini-game will get the attention of the characters which will then progress the story.

Apart from the mini-game, players will need to challenge various musicians and in that case, the game will have players hold their console in different orientations to play the instruments available in the game.

Apart from the story mode, the game also offers players to compete with each other or the CPU on playing some of the in-game tunes and each player can choose which instrument they would like to play.

If players link their Neo Geo Pocket Color to the Dreamcast, they can transfer the points they've earned in this game to unlock more costumes and characters in Cool Cool Toon.
title: Cool Cool Jam

description:
nige-ron-pa is a turn-based role playing game set in the world the game was named after featuring humans, elves, demons and other creatures co-existing with each other.

Players take control of an elf and a catgirl who are about to take the exam and become workers. After passing the exam and obtaining a license, players can accept various tasks which will reward them with money and Worker points.

The worker points serve both as the game's reputation system and are an integral part of the game's license system. They determine who would accept to be a part of the player's party, as well as allow players to get new licenses, which works in a similar way to Final Fantasy's job system. Equipping different licenses will unlock different spells for players to use in battle. The more worker points players get, the more likely it is that additional characters can be hired.
title: nige-ron-pa

description:
Dynamite Slugger is a baseball game. Players can select to play as a team from one of the 12 countries available in the game.

The game has 3 modes available for players to play:* Exhibition

  • Pennant Race
  • Tournament
title: Dynamite Slugger

description:
Mizuki Shigeru no Yōkai Shashin Kan is an RPG starring a pupil of Shigeru Mizuki, a specialist in stories of Yōkai and takes place in places modeled after real Japanese locations. The pupil goes out to take a photo of the leader of a group of ghosts that have escaped from ancient times. The photo is needed to make an amulet that will help banish the ghosts from the world once and for all.

The aim of the game is to talk to people, find out where to find Japanese spirits and then take photos of them using a mysterious camera called Ungai. Picture taking is the game's form of combat. Not only must players move the camera when taking a photo, they must make sure the picture comes out sharp as blurry photos will decrease the player's health.
title: Mizuki Shigeru no Yōkai Shashin Kan

description: The player takes the role Sei Tenshi Takeru, exploring a festival to participate in the attractions, which take the form of mini-games. The player is require to pay in coins to play the mini-games (except a free one, which earns coins). Upon winning the mini-games, the prize (depending on the player's score) consists of coins or the occasional rare seal. As the player completes objectives, additional mini-games become available to play. The game can also be connected Sega Dreamcast version for extra content.
title: Bikkuriman 2000: Viva! Pocket Festiva!

description: This game simulates a school girl going out on date. The player creates a character and then is able to choose one or more activities for the day in order to progress the story, but there's a not really anything else the player can control. The player's stats increase with every successful step towards finding a boyfriend.
title: Pocket Love: If

description: This game has the player create a profile, send out party invitations and use picture cards to counter the enemy critters with some menu options in between scenes. The player can also wirelessly send emails to another player via the same game on the same system.
title: Party Mail

description: As part of the Real Casino Series, this game has the player in a game Baccarat in a casino. There are two available modes consisting of Original Mode for the special odds and Casino Mode, which incorporates the basic rule. As per the traditional rules of baccarat, the player must place a bet and have the higher score to earn credits.
title: Neo Baccarat

description: King of Fighters: Battle de Paradise takes the form of a party game. The player chooses one of six fighters or one of four mystery fighters. After choosing a difficulty and a scene, the player reach the goal in a number of dice rolls before the opponent does. Depending on the square the player lands on, they will be granted either additional coins or be treated to mini-games, some of which require the player to get a better score than the opponent. There also exists a hidden mini-game when played on an original Neo-Geo Pocket.
title: The King of Fighters: Battle de Paradise

description: Based on the visual novel featuring Yuka Kawashima, the story is told in text with monochrome backgrounds and colored character head and body shots. Occasionally the player can choose a menu option to determine how the story progresses.
title: Infinity Cure

description: As part of the Real Casino Series, this game has the player in a game Blackjack in a casino. There are two available modes consisting of Original Mode and Casino Mode as well as a player versus player mode. The player starts with 100 credits and decide on how much to place a bet. As per the traditional rules of baccarat, the player must have the have cards that sum up to 21 or close and not go over that number. There are thirteen possible winning patterns which win the player various amounts of credit.
title: Neo 21

description: This riichi-styled game of Mahjong has a selection of eleven different characters to play as. There can be up to three CPU opponents. Following traditional Mahjong rules, the player must get the highest score above other opponents. The player may reveal their hand earning extra points for a winning hand.
title: Doko Demo Mahjong

description: This game simulates Japanese Derby horse racing. The player choose a game type, followed by the racing date, the type of horse, the betting mode and value and the horse's number. The horse's chances of winning or losing are based on a particular probability associated with it. Based on what type of betting mode was chosen, the player may earn winnings or lose altogether.
title: Neo Derby Champ Daiyosō

description: This game incorporates the game mechanics of the tile game Mahjong with the card game Koi-Koi. There are eight characters to pick from. Using traditional Mahjong rules, the player must earn a higher point count than the opponent.
title: Koi Koi Mahjong

description: This game incorporates real Japanese baseball teams for the 1999 season such as the Fukuoka Daiei Hawks and Fighters Tokyo. There is also a choice of four different baseball stadiums each with a different field size. The player is responsible for managing the team. The player then has to play either as the batter or as the pitcher in attempt to make the chosen team the winning one.
title: Neo Poke Pro Yakyū

description: This game quizzes and teaches users proper grammar and spelling in the Kanji script. After choosing an exercise difficulty, the player must answer as many multiple choice question correctly in the shortest time possible.
title: Mesaze! Kanji-ō

description: In line with the traditional Pachinko rules, the player plays on a single screen launching a number of balls across the table to try and rack up a high score. If a ball enters the central niche, the slot machine is activated, which randomly determines if the player gets a winning pattern or not.
title: Pachinko Hisshō Guide: Pocket Parlor

description: Based on the Type-B slot machine of the same name by Mizuho Brand, the player places adjustable bets to roll three columns in an attempt to score 3-in-a-row patterns of fantasy monsters, 7 symbols or match the upper and lower half of a pentagram symbol to earn winnings.
title: Pachi-Slot Aruze Ōkoku Pocket: Ward of Lights

description: Based on a typical skill-stop slot machine branded by Hanabi, the game is played like a typical casino fruit machine but with manga-styled pictures which must be matched as 3-in-a-row patterns horizontally and/or diagonally depending on the bet made.
title: Pachi-Slot Aruze Ōkoku Pocket: Daihanabi

description: Based on Eleco's slot machine of the same name, the player places adjustable bets to roll three columns in an attempt to score 3-in-a-row patterns of Mexican objects, 7 symbols or match the upper and lower half of an Aztec sun symbol to earn winnings.
title: Pachi-Slot Aruze Ōkoku Pocket: Del Sol 2

description: Based on the Electrocoin machine of "Adventure of Porcano", the player places adjustable bets of up to 50 credits to roll three columns in an attempt to score 3-in-a-row patterns of various symbols to earn winnings.
title: Pachi-Slot Aruze Ōkoku Pocket: Porcano 2

description: This game revolves around the theme of baseball but has the core mechanics of a typical slot machine with the player required to match baseball pictures of the same type or 7 symbols in a row of three horizontally or diagonally depending on the bets that were set. Up to 50 credits can be inserted into the slot machine. Sometimes the top flyer will roll and change depending on the player's winning or losing status.
title: Pachi-Slot Aruze Ōkoku Pocket: Dekahel

description: Based on Eleco's slot machine of the same name, the player places adjustable bets to roll three columns in an attempt to score 3-in-a-row patterns of fruit among other symbols to earn winnings. Up to 50 credits can be inserted into the slot machine.
title: Pachi-Slot Aruze Ōkoku Pocket: e-CUP

description: Based on the "Fireworks" slot machine, this game features Aruze's manga character Don Chan and is played like a typical casino fruit machine but with manga-styled pictures which must be matched as 3-in-a-row patterns horizontally and/or diagonally depending on the bet made. Sometimes the top flyer will roll and change depending on the player's winning or losing status.
title: Pachi-Slot Aruze Ōkoku Pocket: Ohanabi
